Sleeping.

I think it looks good.

At least he's got people around him.

Please, a little decorum if you will. What I was going to say is, is that holding that baby in my arms, I felt like I was twenty-one again. A call like that makes me think of going back to three nights a week, not two, start running again, cut down on the drinking.
I hate vodka.

You don't know the first thing about rule number three, cannot begin to understand the complexities of that rule. Come on, let's go look at some hookers. The Kit Kat will be letting out.  Don't ever call a junkie whore a crackhead. They get real mad.

No, you never listened. I was going, man, if someone on high hadn't pulled me in. I had put all I had into saving this dumbass lowlife suicidal that when he went down, there was a part of me that wanted to go with him.
Where the guy jumped and you almost fell. No, you never told me that story.
I ever tell you about the time years ago I was on this ledge uptown, trying to talk this psycho inside?
He's dead unless you folks want to stop bullshitting me and tell it straight. Then, Lord willing, we'll try to bring him back.
He's not dead. It's a heroin overdose. Break out the Narcon.
She loves me the way no woman ever has.
Is it true that you and Love went on a blind date?  She hit you with a bottle?
She only works when I'm on. I make her wait and it drives her crazy.
It can always get worse. You can't change what's out there, only where you're coming from. You got to let the Lord take over, in here.
I think the worst is over.
You ever notice people who see shit always, are crazy?
The ghosts--
Nobody gets fired. Look at me. Only thing they might do is transfer you to the Bronx. You look like you aged ten years since I rode with you last.
The captain almost fired me tonight. I'm on my way out. Anytime now.
My Lord mother man, you look like hell. What were you drinking?
Upstairs. 212. Had to shock him twice more.
Where's Burke?
Crazy fucker.
No.
Jesus Christ. Nurse Crupp!  Anybody else hurt?
Last show of the night.
A medical miracle.

That's good, Frank. No, but they might surgically implant one, about the size of my thumb. It goes near the shoulder here, with two electrodes connected to the heart. It sends a shock whenever it senses a drop in blood flow. Amazing, isn't it?
What do you do, just have someone follow him around with a defribilator?
Fourteen. We finally got him a room upstairs. Should be up there in a couple of hours.
How many times have you shocked him tonight?
You can't believe how much he's improved.
Can't tell. It was a breech, twins. The other one seems okay, though. Marcus is taking him and the mother to Maternity.
Oh Jesus, put her on the monitor. Where's the pediatric code cart?  Odette give me that tube. All right, flatline--let's do CPR. step back, Frank. How many months?

I wanted to bring them in, to see if he'd respond to voices, but they weren't in the waiting room. The guy's daughter was in my face all last night and when I finally have something positive to tell her, she's gone.

Who knows? It's all lower-brain-stem- activity. The heart refuses to stabilize--he's coded eleven times since he got here. This guy's a fighter. Every time the Valium wears off he starts yanking those restraints.
What do you think?

Burke. You won't believe it. He's showing cognitive signs. He started with spontaneous respiration, now he's fighting to pull out the tube. Had to sedate him. He's in a CAT scan. I'm giving him every test I can: thromboytics, steroids, nitrodrips, heparin.
That guy I brought in yesterday, post-cardiac arrest. He's gone.

No, that's Noel. Used to be a regular off and on, hasn't been in in a while. He seized and almost coded--I gave him a hypertonic solution. He drank so much the kidneys were taking out salt. One for the textbooks.
He one of them?
I hate pronouncing people dead over the phone.  Better, huh? They're fixed and dilated. He's plant food.
He got better.
Yes.
Would you like to come in?
You have to keep the body going until the brain and heart recover enough to go on their own.
I'm sorry.
He was tough. You did all you could.
He coded. They shocked him one too many times. I'm sorry.
How can that be? He was getting better.

You're crazy.
We're gonna save you, Noel. You're gonna be all right.  Do it, Tom! I'll call for fucking backup, I swear!
Frank!
Do it!
Frank!
Get the kit! We're gonna tube him!

Okay, whatta I do?

Look at that. Tell me that's a crazy person. Every move is calculated. He knows exactly what he's doing. This is the guy. I've been after him for weeks. He's quick, runs like a rat, tough for one person, but with two of us--
Well, why don't they put him away? Prisons don't want him. I took him to the hospital yesterday and here he is again.

This guy's been terrorizing the neighborhood for weeks, ever since he got outta jail, wreaking general havoc, contributing to the bad name of the place. The term "menace to society" was made up for him.
Let me think.
What's the reason? Give me a reason, Tom.
You need a reason, Frank. You don't just go around breaking people's windows. That's anarchy.
Destruction, distraction. I feel the need.
Why?
I don't know--let's break some windows.
What do you want to break?
Let's break something, Tom. Let's bust something, bomb something.
That's your job. Just keep driving, keep moving. No stopping. We're sharks. We stop too long, we die.
Who with?
Let's get in a fight, then.
You want some bum in the bus terminal? We'll wait for a real call.

C'mon, look at your screen. Give up some blood!
As long as we keep moving. No standing still.
Get ready, Frank. Missed a drug shooting while you were dicking around in there. There's gonna be trauma tonight!

Hold it, hold it. Here.
Whoa, whoa, whoa.
'Cause you're a jag-off. I would have fuckin' made you lay ten...
Well, how come I laid nine?
Kill you,  You motherfucker you!  Frankie, do him a fuckin' favor.
Kill me, you fuck, kill me.
Charlie M? You make me pop your fuckin' eye out of your head to protect that piece of shit? Charlie M? You dumb motherfucker!
Charlie M.
Charlie M?
Ch-Charlie M!
Oh, God! Give me the fuckin' name!
This motherfucker, do you believe this? Two fuckin' days and nights!  Fuck me?
Fuck you!

Listen to me, Anthony. I got your head in a fuckin' vise. I'm gonna squash your fuckin' head like a grapefruit if you don't give me a name. Don't make me have to do this, please. Come on. Don't make me be a bad guy. Come on.
Your fuckin' head, huh? Don't fuck around, Tony.
My fuckin' head.
Yeah, I know, that's why you had it ready. You thought I was fuckin' layin' it?!
I'm sorry, Nicky. I didn't mean anything by it.
Maybe if I stick your fuckin' face through this window over here like, you know, you'll - you'll get unconfused. Give me the fuckin' money!
Yeah.
You're a little confused?
Well, I'm a little confused here.
I'm positive.
You sure?
I was layin'? No, no, I'm taking it. I was takin' it.
What thing? Oh, Nicky... I thought you was layin'.
All right, yeah. You got that thing for me?
How you doin'?
How you doin'?
Hey.
Tony.
Mr. Chairman -
Do I hear a motion seconded?
Denying?
...this, uh, this Commission is prepared to act on a motion denying the Rothstein application.
No, I want to have this marked, Mr. -
Pardon me, counselor. Before you continue...
Then do it the way you want.
...done right, you gotta do it yourself.
You are right. What can I...
...everything's comin' out of my pocket. I gotta pay for all these trips back and forth, back and forth.
You know, I - I'm too upset right now. And - An end has to be put to this.
You'll get a heart attack like that.
All right, all right. But I - I -
Take it easy, though.
I can't take this no more. Back and forth, back and forth.
I know it, I know it.
You know - You know - You know what they're doin' to me?
I know, but that's enough.
Mom, I'm sorry, they're beatin' me left and right.  Ma, I'm sorry. I'm all upset.
All right, take it easy now, take it easy.
...behind my head. They trust that scumbag, I don't. Right now, the way I feel, I'll hit the two of them in the head with a fuckin' shovel.
I've never trusted him. And you know I got eyes...
I'm sorry.
That's enough.
I didn't curse. I said 'frickin' head'.
Again!
Nance gives me trouble and I'll tell him... screw around with those suitcases and I'll take the eyes out of his frickin' head.
There's a lot of people here.
I'm sorry.
Since when do you talk like that?
Receipts and bills and... everything's here.
What's the matter with you?
Oh, sorry -
Hey! Oh!
Uh, I have a plane to catch to Cleveland...  Can I get my winnings?
You'll want to count the money in privacy. You know, you don't need...
Yes, uh...
Having a good time?
Hi.
Why don't I take him over to the office and verify it, huh?
Yeah.
Hiya. That's a lot of money to be counting out in public.
Adonis, be polite. She's a friend.
Yew'll be ovah in the naxt tehn minutes...
I'm not going to worry about it. We are quite beyond the computer disc. Everything will be over within the next hour or so.
I don't know about you, guys, but I'm getting a little buzz off this.
Works for me.
Ayy!  Some cat's blocking the periscope.  Somebody, give it a swat...
Have we reached the epi-center?
It's okay. Let her go.
Oh Man, not the sewer, I just had this cape cleaned...
You have to dial nine first.
I still have to call my agent--my techno-single just made the hot 100...what's with the phone?
Do I have to remind everyone that in two days, we'll all be dead. The Cult of Good will be a memory. I don't want to hear about lawsuits or cereals. We have a secret mission...
Crowd always buys it. What do we got?
The crowd bought it.
Sorry, sir. The Cult is my life and my life is the Cult. By God, Captain God, I shall not fail you..
Hey, Hot Stuff. You're still on the clock...
Yeah, all those women who went feline this afternoon...They're so ashamed now..
You know, nobody likes you...
That's a good one, dude. He says we're going to kill you whether you tell us where the disc is or not.
Be verwy, verwy, quiet; I'm hunting Catwomen.
Ah, Cats. Now and Forever.
This looks promising...
I thought we were going to take it easy until the Mission...
Oops--my face must match my cape. And to think we were going to let you go...
Cactus, I can't believe you just said all that...
I lied.
I thought you said you weren't a very good liar.
We'll hunt him down together...
In many ways, that obnoxious creep Cactus was the worst one of all. He got off on giving out pain...
You're serious?  You'd help me...
It would be honor, Brock. Now let's go get this guy...
This ring belonged to my sister. I'd love for you to...
Somewhere very far away, very quiet, and very...  This is all wonderful, Selina, but...But I'm afraid I can not rest until all my sister's killers are brought to justice...That one-armed monster..
Oh now, you put up a good fight. Let's change the subject. Where do people who live in Oasisburg go to get away from it all?
A couple that battles the forces of evil together is a couple that stays together.  Thank you, Jeff.
Quite a pair we make. Thank you, Jeff.
I still can't get over it. I still can't believe you're Catwoman..
No-o. You know, questions like that don't help your cause--
You're telling the truth. I can tell..How did this..
Hmm. Not bad.
What did you say?  Selina, sit down, the entire city is going crazy...You have to just calm down...
Tonight, somewhere in the city, innocent people will die--but then one of you knows that; for one of you is a vicious pirate-terrorist posing as the beloved superhero Captain God.
Uh Brock, today you are without me...
Exactly. I don't know what I'd do without you.
At some sanctimonious celebration of condescension. Nothing like appeasing half the population with a two hour luncheon.
Fine. You're angry. Don't be. The important thing is we're together now..
I got home fine. How's the "warehouse."
Selina, did you make it home, all right?  I tried calling, but your mother said that there was "no extension in the Hut." Whatever that means..
I'm sure.
Are you sure?
Your warehouse?  Go on ahead--to your "warehouse." I'll be okay...
This is insane. Let the heroes handle it.  I'd better get you home...I should check on my warehouse to make sure it hasn't been hit...
Well, it's just that I would think that the woman who is the real, non- imitation Catwoman would be pretty angry at some little amateur minx stealing the whole whip idea. Really angry.
What's the matter?  What are you saying?
A whip?  Now that's going too far!  Some of these women have no shame!
No it's not.
What little boy doesn't...  My God...it's, it's...Catwoman.
I'm sorry I went off like that, I get passionate. I--I guess I'm a passionate person. One of those things I had forgotten.  When you were a little boy did you want to grow up to be a superhero?
So, did you see "Seinfeld" last week? That Kramer-guy really makes me laugh.

Stop. We are not having a "duality" conversation. "Ooh, he has a secret side.  Ooh, she has a dark side." Please.  Duality is a joke. You get one, do you understand me?  You get one life. One shot. I'm so tired of women saying "I have an inner strength" or "Deep down, I'm really ambitious." "One day I'll design my own line of clothing and write children's stories, if I can only remember to return the videos I rented last night." If you are something, then you better be out there doing something.  You need to be the same bold thing in the day that you are at night--with maybe a slight clothing change. There is no gray area. The truth is not somewhere in between. There are two sides to every personality, all right--the reality...and the lie. We are not having a "duality" conversation.

I despise these kind of winds. Sorry, I guess I'm a little on edge. Seems this Catwoman has everyone, men and women, on edge. Don't you feel Catwoman says something about the duality of all men and women...
You're very special. Selina, I'm not a very good liar. I feel very strongly about you...forgive me use of architecture metaphors, but I instantly know a good foundation when I see one..
I checked out your stuff at the library.  Awesome work, really. Why would someone like you want to go out with a...with a..what exactly am I, again?
Hey, hey, the client comes first. You think I want my future children to know their Daddy created Frank's Fun Palace?
Oh, it's superb--I mean if you like that fascist nightmare kind of thing...
What did you think?
You designed Gotham Plaza?  The big silver guys pulling on those big silver things...
I'm not afraid. Are you?
There's a nice cafe down the street...unless you're afraid of this Catwoman prowling around. We can always dine at the mansion, if..
But of course you are. Dinner at Eight.  Wouldn't miss it.
Kincaid got a little frisky last night...So, meet here at eight and go from there?  By the way, I'm Brock Leviathan.
How heroic of you...

I was wondering, if you're not doing anything tonight...Would you like to go to dinner? I know; a tame suggestion considering the wide variety of miniature golf possibilities available to the Oasisburg citizen--but nevertheless, would you?
You're probably right.
I'll bet the butler's name wasn't "Jeff."
Nothing, just a jolt of deja-vu. I think I went out with a guy with a dignified British butler--can't remember how it turned out..
What's the matter...
I wonder..
Strange--you seemed so close. I wonder what's happened since yesterday..
I don't know. I can't remember.
Ouch. I hope you're not offended by aggressively curious men.
Guilty. I am.
You say that like an amnesia victim.
I'll bet. Funny, for some reason, I don't think dogs are supposed to like me.
No, in art. I try not bring up women around Kincaid. It's a sore spot between us. Long story..
In women?
He likes you. Kincaid and I have always had similar tastes...
What little boy doesn't?
I guess we did. When you were a little boy, did you want to be a superhero?
But then we knew that all along, didn't we...
I've been looking for you.  Selina Kyle was right. One of us is a psychotic crusader.
I've been looking for you.
It may be time to get the police involved...
I can. That's not an admission of guilt,  It's just..I knew you had it in you...
Did you ever think that maybe neither of us is Captain God?

Quiet, Blender Boy. I told you from the beginning, Selina, I'm not a very good liar. I am not Captain God, or whatever else he may be calling himself this month, but when I find out who is--The Man will pay.  My sister died in that Museum attack. You can check the Atlanta obituaries. I've tracked these monsters from city to city, waiting for a time to exact my revenge. Why else would I come to Oasisburg and create the most obnoxious casino in the world?
We're waiting.
Your uniform, that first time I saw you, was a ghastly cage I vowed to unlock in order to..

You're right, I wasn't looking to fall in love with a casino worker. I'd given up trying to find anyone. But there was a fire in your eyes that cut right through the air conditioning and through the coldness of my heart.
But it's true!  You can call him yourself.
You're kidding.
Yes, did you call us here for any particular reason?
Selina, are you okay?
Oh, you don't have to explain to me where you're going...
I better go report this in...
I suppose she does.
She has reason to be suspicious..Doesn't she?
A bit on the suspicious side, don't you think?
She has a real spirit.
Selina Kyle...lovely person.
They do take their time. So..Selina Kyle...
Women, huh?
Can I just say what a classy touch the neon urinals are, Mr. Architect?  I just love risking electrocution every time I..
Oh, how long have you had your own route?
There you are darling...Have we met, Lewis Lane, Oasisburg Times.
Oh come on, Cactus, be a man!  The blimp is still on schedule, right?
Catwomen. Lots of them!
Wha-at?
God, can you hear me!
Just hold on!  I'm not done. There are two kinds of men in the world, Selina. In Category A, you have Me. In Category B is everyone who wants to be in Category A, but are too afraid, too weak..!
Boss, we better roll if we're going to hit this place, blow it up, and make that flight..
Don't you feel so much better now that you know everything?  Blink once for yes, twice for..
Priceless...We have a showdown in this alley, right?
Hey, speaking of Wrong Place, Wrong Time.  Lewis Lane to the rescue!
You've lost all motor functions. The poison will kill you in ten minutes.
What about "climbing in?"
The "skylight?" Fool!  It's too high for anybody to climb out the damn skylight...
Even the skylight?

Don't you realize there's nothing you can do, anyway!  Nine minutes and it's all over!  The Fun Palace is a tomb. No one can get out. And choke on this furball: all doors and windows are blocked, locked, and electrified!  Even the glass around the bomb is rigged.
Well then, let's agree to disagree...Now how about a picture for my scrapbook?
You might be right, but Fun is overrated.  I need something real.

Will you please stop fighting?  Just let those people die so we can get on with our new lives together!  Trust me, one day we'll look back on this day and laugh. You got to admit, it's a lot more fun to be the villain.
I know, I know, a Warrior. You're very annoying..Now tell me how to defuse the bomb you've set..
You were right all along--the two parts to a person are the reality and the lie.  I was making good money as a top architect--but that's not who I am. I'm not an architect, I'm a..
Pass!

I've been thinking. I've been thinking about us. I'm sorry I've been so hard no you these past couple days. I realize now it's because you're the only woman who ever understood me and I couldn't handle it!  I've never revealed myself to anyone the way I have to you. Let's blow this town together.  We'll run a bed-and-breakfast in Vermont by day, and by night, we'll dress up and kill anything that...
Oh Honey, it's so much better when we do it without the helmet.
My dog!
At this point, a nap. Oh by the way, I killed your butler and your dog..
What do you want from me?
Winning.
I thought cats were supposed to have nine lives, not thirty one!  What do you think you're doing?
Touchy. Look everybody, it's Casper, the friendly crimefighter...
Cactus, sometimes you don't deserve to wear our logo.
Yeah, this is better than rape.

Resting Up?  Sorry Spooky, I've got to go with God on this one. I hate to think we're just in this for the money.  Garfield's girlfriend crossed a line last night and she's got to get spayed. We're going out of Oasisburg on a win.

Not now, Mammoth. Adonis is right. We've had a good run here--the protection kickbacks from the crime syndicates, the merchandising scams-- Tomorrow night we have a big, violent, complicated and lucrative mission to pull off. We chould be resting up.
Ooh, I've read about this philly. She's the one who gave that wimp Batman all those migraines up in Gotham...
What's the catch?
He didn't remember to roll up his window...
"Dat's gotta hurt!"
I hate innocent bystanders.  Whine, whine, whine. Will he settle?
The shopkeeper on 13th street won't drop the lawsuit--He still claims one of the lasers we fired at the Jenkins gang burned down his store..
I'll put that in the report--after you shoot her.
My, the Perpetrator seems to be a bit on the "Wild" side..
Absolutely.
Car wash, Captain?
I got her...
Quite a little performance you gave in the casino today--for me and that other guy. Come on down, let's chat..
Yeah...pretty gross. Hurry, we've got work to do.
Ah, did you hear that?  Spooky loved you...
I know how you feel, humiliated in the hands of a woman. I'd rather eat my soul on a paper plate...
Sorry man, I didn't mean that personally...
What did you say?
God-damn..
How could I forget. Mammoth--go pet the kitty.
I don't know, Boss, you saw what the big guy did to the last kitty we gave him.
Why am I still troubled...
Right time. That was kind of fun. She had spunk.
I don't know what I was saying. I totally phoned it in last night. I haven't been getting a lot of sleep lately...
Boss-man, what were you going on about last night: "I am the Law and I am the Danish..."
Well. I stand corrected.
That is not a man, Captain God. That is Vomit accidentally born with two legs.
Cactus--shooting a man in the back is not very noble.
"Well done," Cactus.
What a "drag."
I know.
I loved you.

Of course it matters!  It throws off everything!  "Superhero" is manhood's highest achievement. Manhood!  Your dirty little secret has diseased us to the core. You were my buddy, my comrade-- women aren't buddies, women aren't warriors!  You tried to turn the Cult of Good into some after-work softball team!  It's time to get thrown from the treehouse...
Why are you--I fought for you with honor.  Why should it matter if I'm a man or a woman, as long as I'm a good warrior.
Just like a woman. You want out. You're out.
I want out of tonight's mission. I can't do it anymore, Captain. I can't let innocent people die to prove our superiority..I can't.
What's the matter with you, Spooky, my most trusted comrade?  We are warriors!  These are the challenges we live for!
I hate it when you get like this. This Catwoman is becoming an obsession. I say we call it a night. Tomorrow is a big day for us...

The Tranquilizer Tranquility will hold for about an hour..where is she? These women are out here on a lark-- Ladies Night at a discotheque.  It's not in their blood the way it is for Catwoman...Where is she?
Oh, I like her. I like her a lot. I want to save this one for later. Something that tasty you don't eat all at once. Go back to your alter- egos, we'll regroup in the morning.
You like them, don't you, Boss.
Just a homeless woman. Wrong place.
Well, you don't see that everyday. Somebody tell me what's the deal with Frida Kahlo here?
A bit sadistic, don't you think, Captain...?
Well, we spent enough time building the damn thing, might as well use it.
Now he'll be up all night...
Oh, I wish they wouldn't feed him like that.
You can't get away with..
Ah, the good guys always triumph in the end. It's what allows our children to sleep at night.

Do you have any idea how much superheroes get paid?  Zilcho. Urban vigilantes with secret identities operating outside the law. Not exactly the stuff of a W-2 form.  If it wasn't for merchandising and corruption and these diabolical "missions"...There is no such thing as heroes and villains, anymore, Selina.  There are only winners and losers. You lost. We won.
I'm supposed to be taking personality tips from you three?  You people were once heroes. You had ideals.  You fought for things.  Spooky told me so...

I know, I should probably tell you, but I just don't feel like it. To be honest, I'm really angry at you. I admired you so much more when you were purely wicked. I mean, look at you now, running around trying to "get to the bottom" of things. Trying to "save the city." It's true we're about to do a very nasty deed, but really, what's it to you?  Since when do you care what happens to a bunch of pathetic Oasiburgians? You're just not yourself, anymore.

How can you say things with such feeling and then turn around and put on a helmet and...Who are you?  Were you sitting on my right or my left at the card table?  Tell me!  Please tell me who you are; you own me that!
You've seen me...
You think so?...Selina?
I still have one left...
Yes. I am the reporter or the architect.  You've been through so much..It looks like you've used up all nine of your lives...
Oh please, sir, one more. Are you the reporter or the architect?

My, those little ears pick up a lot. The Cult of Good will die heroically preventing a world-class heist. Since we will be the ones performing the heist, our deaths will obviously be fake. But have no fear. There will be many other deaths tomorrow...and those will be quite real. I'm afraid these questions of yours put you in a position not unlike a long-tailed tabby in room full of rocking chairs.
"A superhero's job is to protect.." Sorry, I can't take you seriously...I overheard you say that tomorrow the Cult of Good will be dead--I should be so lucky--what did that mean?
A superhero's job is to protect society.  Don't blame me if society is a horrible, corrupt joke.
It's a lot more fun than fighting violence with pamphlets. That voicebox of yours is a hoot. Say "I'm wearing no underwear"--it'll be funny..  You do know you're evil, don't you?
Hasn't anyone ever taught you that fighting violence with violence solves nothing.
And...your point?
You're not a super-hero. You're not even a hero. You're a scary, sick, fake who made a big mistake. You killed someone very special to me..
Hello, Rachel. I'm Selina.
You know, my name's not Spooky. It's, it's Rachel.
"Save the City?" I don't want to save the city, I want to move!  Listen, I'm sure the computer disc is pretty fascinating and I can't thank you enough for the little weird gold thingie, but..
The Mission is happening tonight..It's up to you to...to save the City...
Oh no, not a computer disc. A computer disc?  Oh man, come on, what do I look like?  I'm not a crime- fighter, I'm not a detective, what, I'm supposed to find some "clues" on this disc. I can't...
And I...I..want you to know our secrets..
For when the..Uh, yeah, thanks, a little gold piece of...gold. Uh...
For when the time comes..
Men, huh?
I heard what you said, Spooky. I can't believe he shot you...
You're not strong. You're scared..scared that someone like me will see right through you. Whatever the Cult of Good was, it's not anymore... You don't have to listen to me, just listen to you..
Can't you understand--I got tired of being a woman. I wanted the respect that only a cape, boots, chestplate, and a mechanical spear can bring..
Whatever you say...Sis.

I don't want to hurt you, Catwoman. Yet.  After tomorrow, you can do anything you want, but please, just stay out of sight for the next 24 hours. I won't stand by and watch my leader get all emotional over an animal like you. I warn you, don't tempt Captain God when he is angry. Let is complete our mission in peace.
Hello, Spooky.
Spear.
Spooky.
Ask me another one--
What's the name of your child's best friend?
How did you know our nanny's name is...Lucky guess!
You mean, "Consuela" is a good mother..
I'm a good mother!
Did you just say "girls?"
You Career girls have no idea what we go through.
You Housewives have no idea what we go through!
Kelly, get to work on those new uniforms.  I'm not running a summer camp here..
What if I were to say "Your Wife"-- as in does she know of your touching mentor-student relationship with the post-Bicentennial babe working the roulette wheel?
What if I were to say "You're Fired?"

Oh Frank, I'm not anti-male, I'm anti- you. Believe me, there's a difference.  Kelly is designing new uniforms for next week. Pay her and thank her. And is it a rule that the hottest places on the planet have the coldest air conditioning.  There's something out there called 73 degrees, look into it.
Hey, you're anti-male.
Can I be frank, Frank?  Your entire existence is sexual harassment. I accept there's not much you can do about it.
Oh, what?  I offer you a job in implied exchange for physical favors and suddenly it's "sexual harassment..."
Stop.
There you are, Selina. I've been thinking..I have some.."positions" opening up..
Yeah, as in born before..Ooh, I suppose it's "sexual harassment" to give a woman a compliment. Sheesh. Come on, gentleman...
"Pre-bicentennial babe?"
You know, Kyle, you're still pretty hot for a pre-Bicentennial babe...
What's the good news?
You're late. I've got some good news and some good news. I'm giving you more hours and the new uniforms came in.
I'll let you know.
We have to do something. What can we do to help, Selina?
Have you seen the Oasisburg Police? They drive golf carts with little red sirens.

Okay. Let's get serious. Of course I know the Cult of Good is not good. Ever since I saw what they did in Atlanta, it has been my mission to expose them. I've followed them to Oasisburg and soon will have enough hard evidence to bring them to real justice. That computer disc could be the final piece to the puzzle. This isn't just a story, Selina--another damn Pulitzer--this is my life.
You know, now that I hear myself tell it, I'm thinking maybe both of you are messing with me. What, you get the Helmet Monday through Thursday, then Brock takes it for the weekend...

Then there's you, Louis, sneaking through back alleys and surprise visiting me at my home..Both of you have been way too frisky from the get- go. I'm actually a pretty amazing person--funny, smart, attractive when I get my sleep--but you two had no way of knowing that-- when I met you both I was basically a morose, depressed amnesiac incapable of any human feeling. The only reason one of you wanted to go out with me is because you knew I was Catwoman.
Not too cool...

Lose the smile, Mr. Good Reflexes. We were having a pretty okay time the other night--good food, good conversation--some Catwomen show up and it's "You need cab fare?; I got to go to my Hideout--Oh, I'm sorry, I mean "warehouse."

Fine, fine, at a later date, I'll be more than happy to talk about my perverse psychological complexities with the one who's not the creep. But for now, I'm drilling inside your brains...I bring up the whole Catwoman thing for one reason.  I bit Captain God in the hand and the next day you both show up equipped with big bandaids and wobbly excuses--  "My grandfather is inventing a new kind of blender.."
Some reporter I am..all this time my story is right there in front..I have a lot of questions.
I'm not through. This will come as a shock. Again, to one of you. I am Catwoman. The Catwoman.
Hey, architect--she's joking. Right, Selina?  Selina?
Uh-huh..
You are...
You can't figure me out. You're the strange one..
I give up. I give up.--I can't figure you out. Not gonna try.
You're scaring me, Selina.  Do it some more.

Go together?  Sure, why not?  Another date with someone who could be an insane messenger of death for all I know. No offense. Hey, lean over, let me smell your breath..Say in a deep voice, "A superhero's job is to protect..."

I'm afraid last night was the last straw of our city's tourists. The Mayor, in his finite wisdom, is throwing a "Month of the Woman" luncheon ball for the public this afternoon to try and calm everyone down. I thought maybe you and I could...
Hey, I thought...

I was doing my job. At the risk of sounding egotistical, I didn't become the best reporter in the world sitting by the phone. I was chasing tail all night--I was not spying, intentionally, on your hot and heavy date with "Brock Leviathan, architect."  I can't believe he ordered white wine.  You do know white wine is not real wine...
I said I saw you last night. What were you doing hiding in that alley, running off when the superhero alarm sounded...
I'm having a hard time picking up your signal this morning--What did you say?
Like you don't know...

About the same. Thanks for asking...Damn blender.  Okay, I can't stand it anymore, I'm dying to know--Did you try on some whiskers last night and hit a 7-11 along with all those other women? You had to have thought about it--a Catwoman for a night?
Nothing. How's your hand?
What?
Did you try to kill...
Actually, yes.
Oh, do you turn around every time somebody just shouts at you?
Yes, you shouted the words "Captain God" at me for no reason...
You turned around!
What did--?
Hey, Captain God!
I thought you'd like a ride to work.  You don't own a cat, do you?
Next time, call...
Well. I'd let you come in, but the place is a mess...
No, of course not. You're listed. Not the hut, exactly, but the rest of..
Ah!  You scared me!  How did you know to come here!  Have you been spying..
Good morning.
Ah!  Ah!--God no, don't tell me you're one of those women who are attracted to ruggedly handsome and brilliant architects..
I am. Dinner with Brock Leviathan...
I was wondering, if you're not doing anything tonight...
But of course you are.
Oh the hand--my grandfather is inventing a new kind of blender and..You know, I realize I've never officially introduced myself...I'm Lewis Lane.
Oh now this one is mine...
Enough.
How much?
I actually got some memory back last night.
Sorry, I get carried away. Once I become interested in someone, I can't stop trying to figure them out...Amnesia victims are challenging..

Most articles focus on the first half of her name--describing some feline monster.  I want the woman of Catwoman. After all, if it was a man dressed as a cat, the story would be on page 23--just another loony. Oh, I want this one. I want her bad..
Yeah, she's okay.

What is it with women and Catwoman? Men have the courtesy to punish the weak, but women love punishing the strong. Don't get me wrong--this Catwoman is a terrifying, subversive menace to everything this community stands for and she must be stopped. It's just, I like her a lot.
I don't know what came over me.
Uh. "Thanks?"

A genuine woman of mystery in Oasisburg.  Amnesia. Bulletholes in exposed stomach badly concealed with body make-up.  Beautiful, intelligent eyes that have no business in "Frank's Fun Palace" or anybody else's Fun Palace for that matter..
"I'll go out with you." Now go get me these old newspapers...
Okay, deal.
What if I say I'll go out with you, so you can have all these great daydreams, but then never actually talk to you again?
It's seeing-eye dogs, ma'am. If I let the cat stay, will you go out with me?
But I'm blind.
I'm sorry, ma'am, there are no pets allowed in the library...
Trust me, you won't have to.
I don't know if I can do it alone.
Do you always listen to what your mother says?  Selina. Something you choose your life. Sometimes your life chooses you.  Save the day..
But I'm not a hero. I'm nobody's heroine..I'm nothing. You've said so yourself many times.
Yes, you do. You have to go rescue all those people...
Mom, not now!  I, I don't know what to do..
I hate it when you let your hair just hang like that...you have such pretty eyes...
They're going to attack Frank's Fun Palace!
Yes, I'm pretty amazing. You should see this...It came this evening.
I never thanked you..the arrow..the motorcycle..the computer disc..You're so different from what I..and so the same.
What kind of name is "Brock Leviathan?"
Mom?  Oh Mom, I messed up...
It's because I didn't come in. I live in the Hut, now. I meant to tell you..See ya.
Where were you last night?  I didn't hear you come in.

Because she asked me--and I couldn't very well turn her down. Don't you remember-- of course you don't remember--that "Hag" is the one who brought you to that hospital in Gotham City. For what it's worth-- currently not much--we owe her your life...When I think about a single woman in Gotham City--amnesia is probably the best thing that could happen to a girl like you...Oh, don't forget your visor.
Uh, it's just--that woman out there-- that horrible Hag. She's the one who keeps following me on her creepy little scooter--And now she's built a hut in the back..Why did you...
Don't sneak up on me...
Oh, so now even the keepers of the city don't meet your standards...You're late.
I'll take your abuse, but it's way too early for the sanctimonious Cult of Gag...

Pretty good...Mom, I don't want you to think I don't appreciate...letting me stay, getting me the job--I've been a mess. I'm still a mess. It's just...we have to start having a different conversation. I can't take..

It's funny, I've heard of giving up finding a man and raising a family to pursue a career. And I've heard of foregoing a career to start a family-- but I think you're onto something new, Selina. "Absolutely nothing"-- Has a ring to it. I think it could catch on...How's that for sarcasm?
Maybe.
Is every single thing out of your mouth since your "accident" have to be a monotone mumble of cheap sarcasm?
Oh Mommy, you're embarrassing me.
Oh, I forgot to tell you, you're on a diet...The fact you're still reasonably pretty is the one thing you got going for you.
A hearty breakfast is the start of a great morning...
Yes, Mother. Dear.
You're late.
Thanks.
Nice breasts.
You going to talk all day?
You're the One. I thought I told you to stay hidden behind the couch, CAT! You've torn the unit apart.  You've driven a great leader insane...
The kicks..the rush..you mean, like pulling heists..faking your own deaths..killing innocent bystanders...like Mexican angels.  I know you're a woman. Do you?

I'm not sad, no, I owe the Captain my life. It's just you think you want to help prevent crime, but you realize that's too complicated. It's a lot more fun to punish crime. Then after a while, you don't care what's a crime and what's not, what you became a Warrior for. You just want the kicks. The rush.
You seem sad, Spooky.
We met on the Internet. The Captain put out a cryptic message calling for a new order of crimefighters. We don't even know each other's true identities...
What's it like being a superhero?  It must be frightfully exciting..How did you guys all get together?
Oh pooh, come now. If you turn me down, I just might throw a fit..you know how us girls can be..
I'm sorry, Miss, one of us needs to keep surveillance...
What's a powerful man like you standing all alone for?  Dance with me?
I would appreciate a little space. Thank you.
I don't see anybody in there but you.
I know.  But it's an emergency. Somebody dying.  Okay?
This is one way.
Any place.
Where do you think you're going?
Hey Buddy!  Can you let me pull over?  Give me some space to pull over.
I won't let him.  He belongs to me now.  Bye, sweetie.
I know he's there!  He doesn't even have the balls to pick up the phone!
I'm sure he'll be heartbroken.
He ran out on me to be with you? Well fuck him!  Everything worked twice as good without him.  We didn't need him then and I don't need him now.
Taking messages.
What are you doing on Theo's line?
Matter of fact I did have a kid once.  But he's a lot better off with his father in Milwaukee.
Don't you have children?
I'm sorry for whatever's happened to you but we're definitely not the right people to do you any good.
Do I hear a woman's voice?
Was someone in an accident?

Any trouble, we whip out our Treasury Department badges -- show them the wire I'm wearing and read them their rights.  Theo seizes the Krugerands as evidence. Naturally they start negotiating. Offer to give us up somebody else. And we listen.  Take notes on who bought what stolen art and tell them we have to clear it with our superiors at Justice.  We pick up their passports -- escort them to their room and leave them all in the bathroom handcuffed to the plumbing.
I am not!  Fuck you!  Theo's a genius.
Oh.  Seems yours girlfriend is casting doubts on your expertise.
What if they do question the authenticity?
Wake up.  Make a right at Ocean Avenue.  The hotel's a few blocks up on the left.
This is my conversation.  I'll say what I fucking please.
Have you got to tell her your life story?
That's all we need.  Better let me drive.
Be careful.  There were people in that crosswalk.
I'm sorry.  You'll do all right without me.  Keep my share.
You gotta just look the other way.
Then whose is it?
I know you feel awful but it's not your responsibility.
Look -- I've got the lives of maybe three innocent people hanging on the end of this line.
He's right, Theo.  She might not be around to back up your story. You could end up in the middle of this.
This Mercedes of yours, what's it look like?
Will you two cut it out?
Did you have to tell her my name?
Theo wants to talk again.
She can't!  It's busted.  Now hand that on back!
I'm not finished.  Under other circumstances I'd gladly go out of my way.  I don't understand why you just don't phone some other person.
I know where it is.  Give me that phone back.
How was I in the wrong?

He's at it again.  Like that night at the Emerald.  This piece of Euro-trash is slapping shit out of his little wife in a back booth -- so Mr. Good Deed here has got to step in and pound the fucker's head into the wall.  Meantime "Wifey" recovers enough to pull off her high heel and nearly take our hero's eye out.  It took six stitches.
I'm trying to help somebody. Okay?
Me, he won't stay on the phone with for five fucking minutes without bitching.
Say something ...
You couldn't hurt me.  But it's the principle.
I didn't hurt you.
So what?  What could be important enough to put your hands on me?
You could've made me lose my call.
What was that for?
I'll explain later.  I'm sort of on hold.
Who's on the phone?
I'm not staying in here with him puking all over the place.  Get this door open!
We've already got an ambulance on the way.  Don't try to get out.
No reason to kill innocent bystanders.  Shit.  I can't hardly move my neck.
It was the fugitive in the Chrysler that caused this.  We were trying to overtake him.
You could've killed us.
Are you guys all right?
I want the gun emptied.  I want to see all six slugs tossed up here. And then I want out.  That's all. <u>OUT</u>!
I told you I should've cuffed him.
I'm the one they'd be looking for.
Which is why we had a lot more to worry about than the law.  These are people who don't worry about reading you your rights.
Mind letting me make the best of a rotten situation?
Can you make him stop!
Yeah, I suppose getting whacked has got to be one of your best ways to die.  Particularly if you're not expecting it.  You don't know what hit you.
Bear right till the fire road ends.  It's not far.
How do we get back to the freeway?
Any time you decide to let me in on it.
You missed.
Only I was sloppy.  I let you take me out.  That was quite a humiliation.
Or relieve me of it later.
In case you crapped out it was my job to go after that briefcase.
Yes sir.
Nels reporting in.  Sit down where you are.  Arms folded.
You almost brain me and lock me in a fucking trunk and you're on my side?  You stupid fuck!
You got it wrong.  I'm the one that's on your side.
Lady, don't let him do it!
See for yourself, federal agent, U.S. Treasury.  On the job.
What's this?
I'm going to level with you officer.
Let's have your license, mister.
Why would I do that?
What'd you do?  Tail me from Brentwood?
They'll wait.  Meantime, raise the lid.
I got to get going.  An agent is showing me a house up on Broad Beach in ten minutes.
Now that'd be a misdemeanor.
I'll see that he stays calm.  Pack the money up and put it in the trunk.
You never miss a trick.
Put those away.  We can't have marks on his wrists.
Now turn around.  I'm going to cuff you.
So Theo and Nels will appear to have whacked each other out and we never existed.  A thing of beauty. Jesus, the shit you come up with!
I prefer to have the sucker die at a more convenient location.  Once Nels arrives with his backpack full of goodies.
You can tell she was really worried about me.
With all those holes Nels pumped in I knew you wouldn't suffocate.
It took you long enough to get my ass out.
What else did you expect him to say?  Do it, Theo -- or give me the gun.
Look, I've got a wife.  I don't care if either of you ever get caught.
He's seen both of us now.
Sure -- and they record your voice.  And later on we all get slammed for kidnap and murder. That's out!
Okay, okay, Lenore, calm down. Either let me call the school or better yet, the F.B.I.
What do you keep making me out to be?
In any event, whatever occurs you do not belt anybody.
Satisfied, Wiseass?
Got your badge?
It's rolled up in the tube on the floor back there.
Let's hope so.  Once you come out and okay everything I'll give Caitlin the sign that she can bring the painting on over.
I improved on the fucking original.

First off, this Mr. Chow Yen doesn't speak a lot of English. The girl with him will interpret. There will be a third person to accompany you into the men's room where you can take count.  I hope you know Krugerands better than they know a <u>Hockney</u>.
Go ahead then.  I'm covering the receiver.  She can't hear.
We still gotta run the drill before we walk in that lobby.
<u>You're</u> doing all the talk.
That's illegal.  You want us pulled over?  I'll turn around at the corner if you'll shut the fuck up.
Make a "U" and go back.
And stop with the directions.
Shit.  There's the hotel.  You overshot the driveway.
If you know that just back off.
Just like they say; no fucking self control.
I don't like anybody laying their hands on me.
That's what I deserve for listening in the first place.
Just hand up on the bitch!  Fuck you, madam.  And goodbye!
Will you relax?  This in no way affects our business.  Go on.
What do you mean tip the cops?  Is the man a lunatic or what?
Wait!  I hear her breathing now. There, she just picked it up again.
That's your "rep."
Bullshit.
That was definitely out of line and totally unprovoked.  I heard you were a hitter.
Not this minute.
We have never worked a gig together but I am a firm believer in preparation.  So let's go over this again step by step.
It's taken care of.
You switched license plates?
Give me 20 minutes at least.
We've had our share of fuck-ups but it's going to work out fine.
I was worried about you.  Both of you.
Any minute.
I'm still in my cab -- jammed up in traffic.  Are you there yet?
Nels?
There's a taxi stand here.  I can meet you.
He took it like a man.  Toss him in that drainage ditch.
Allow me.
Don't fuck around.  Pop a cap in him.
We'll toss it when we make the blind curve.
Lose the hardware now.
What am I supposed to do?
Nels, don't let that cop pass you.
I'm doing fine.  Theo wants to deal.
I thought you said you could handle him.
I told you ... sooner or later you'd have to trust me ...
Sure, like I'm gonna take advice from you.
My fence in San Francisco ... 305-4410.  Maurice.  Don't take less than a third on the face value of those bonds.
I don't want it.
I've got ... one last number for you, Theo ...
-- The phones, Theo.  Don't leave any of them behind.  The cops could pull up a record of all our calls and -- find you.
Turns out you did me a favor. You're looking at a rich man.
I picked the wrong number when I chose you ... didn't I?
Toss them -- one at a time.  I don't want to lose count.
Five ... six.
Pull over!  Pull over someplace.
It's going to be some fucking snowstorm.
You won't live to see it.
Think about what's going to happen to your valuables when that trunk flies open at 75 miles per?
Take your hand out of there. Slowly.
Know what else is in here?
Local lawyer for Dominican dealers.  Off to buy a half interest in a mall in Granada Hills on their behalf.
Exactly who was this Oberfeld?
Took preparation.
Some nice fantasy you all cooked up for me.
That's a skill you acquire when you do fantasy phone sex for a living. I must've had thirty regulars salivating at 4.99 per minute.
Just sitting here listening to her voice does it to me all over again.  No harm admitting I fell in love with the sound of you.
Nothing but CDs in there.  I thought maybe you'd like some Celine or Whitney.
Both hands on your lap.
He let the fucking cop out -- but he won't --
I'm handling it.
That's how it's going to be.
That's not good enough.
I'm going to cuff you and leave you in that house.  It may take awhile but you'll be found after we're long gone.
Only one way to find out.
Maybe your friends already accomplished that chore for us.
Naturally.
Naturally.
You're the man with the gun.
Which one of us is elected to do the deed?
We can't leave him to repeat anything.
What's your point?
He might've heard everything we said in the car.
That's a reasonable possibility.
The cop in the trunk -- he could still be alive.
What's really on your wicked little mind?
How about "later?"
Sooner or later you'll learn to trust me.
Yeah, I was waiting for that suggestion.
We had a backup plan.  But I knew you'd come through for me.
You've had a lot of fun with me today.  What would you have done if I hadn't responded to your call?

As a child I hated being told how sweet I looked.  That angelic little face wasn't me at all.  I had to hurt people to prove to them they had the wrong image. Sometimes words were enough -- but I wasn't beyond inflicting physical pain in order to be taken seriously.  I enjoyed seeing the shock on their poor faces when they realized who I was.  That same look you gave me when I turned the gun on you.
Who'd ever think, to look at you?
I need a break.  I've been on a marathon run ever since I had the misfortune to strike up a conversation with you.
Why are we stopping?
Developer ran out of money years back.  I'd hate to think about what's living in there.
I had it in my mind what you'd look like.  "Her," I could've painted.  <u>You</u>, I'd be afraid to turn my back to mix the colors.
Think you could do a picture of me?
That's where this Chicano correctional officer first taught me to slap paint on a canvas.  I could copy any fucking thing he put in front of me.
They did some great job of reforming you.
I was sentenced to a youth camp out here when I was fourteen.  We cleared some of these same roads.
Any idea where you're going?
The money, Nels ... ?
Wonderful feeling of security knowing your adversaries are both crippled and unarmed.
I can't hear.  Now there's a siren.  They must be in an ambulance.  What about the money?  Nels?
What's happening?
Some people fall apart in a pinch. But you shine.
That's why we're turning off onto a fire road.
They'll have units blocking us up ahead.
Ask them.
Do you think they'll walk away?
Dial him up.  We need him to run interference.
What's Nels' number?
No, there's a police car way back there.  See it, in the distance coming around the turn?  The van is blocking it now.
It could be a fire.  This is Malibu.
Let me talk to him.  Hold the phone to my ear -- but don't nudge me.
Did you hear that?
Plus names, addresses and I.D. for the lot of you.  We're in this together and I need to know who my partners are.  In case I ever need to roll over on somebody.
He wants 75 back.
Inform him the fee is seventy-five large for your return.  All parts intact.
I'm still okay.
Then scream for me.  A repeat performance.  Let me see how easy you can turn it on.  Scream!  I want to hear you scream for me!
Stop talking like that!

Yes I would.  Not kill you.  But blow off a few toes, absolutely. I'm entitled to that as retribution.  It'll help you to remember me in years to come -- every time you put on stockings. They must have prosthetic toes by now -- with little nails on them you can polish --
You wouldn't --
Only in the leg or the thigh. You'd live but you just wouldn't wear shorts.
You could've hit me.
Now you're starting to sound like a victim again.
You're enjoying this too much.
I think it was my tone of voice more than anything else that sold you.  And when you thought I was being kicked around, I wish I could've seen your face.
I guess I ought to stop seeing woman as victims.
Naturally you didn't learn your lesson.
You were at the Emerald that night?
Oh no, you were too busy trying to keep some Croatian from slapping the shit out of his girlfriend. She showed her gratitude by almost taking your eye out with her spiked heel.
You, I would've noticed.
I knew you were a loser the first night I laid eyes on you.
What's that supposed to me?
A typical fuck-up.
Those shots your associates got off may not have done him too much good.  That's on their head.  All I did I was put him there.
I don't hear him moving around anymore.
Granted, the cops are not an alternative.  Certainly not with one of their own still locked in my trunk.
The one thing you don't want is to attract the police.
I'm not trying to lose them.  Nor am I exceeding any speed limits.
He seems to be headed for Topanga.
Absolutely.  And Topanga Canyon has a hell of a lot of potholes if I recall.
Do you have to point that?
We might hit a bump and the gun might go off.  Ever see that Tarantino movie -- where Travolta blew that guy away in the back seat -- purely by accident?
You won't shoot me.  That's not your style.
Not all.  They already have a third.  The question is how much of that are they willing to give to get you back?
He seems to think he's entitled to it all.
Tell them I'm keeping what's left. I earned it.  I probably killed some poor bastard for it.
Assure them that you're being well treated.
There's no way out for you.  You have to deal with us.
Your friends are probably still on the line.  Pick it up and say hello.
Shit.  You couldn't be in much worse shape.
L.A.P.D.
Who's in back?
You knew about me.
Nobody's easier to con than a con man.
Why pick me to be your "mark?"
Sit completely still with both hands on the wheel -- until they get here.
There was <u>no</u> cop involved.  Oh shit!  Fuck!
I thought it was inspired.
And all that crap about your driver being murdered by a cop --
As they say -- no good deed goes unpunished.
I got what I fucking deserved.  I had it all.  I could've kept going!
They always pick Rachel up early on Thursday.
You timed that beautifully.
Plus they'll remember you going after his daughter at school.
At least one.
The video cameras will put you with him in the bank, and I'll bet there were enough witnesses.
Damned if I know.
Jack Oberfeld in person.  Did you kill him?
The guy with the transplant.
It belongs to the man you took it from.  Or should I saw <u>stole</u> it from?
Whose money is this?
There isn't any such person.
You're not Lenore Oberfeld.
The rest of the money is here in the car.  Why don't you come and get it?
Why are you telling him that.  Are you crazy?
He had a gun.  I have it now.
Hand me the phone.
For Christ sakes don't point it at me.  We want to get Rachel out of there in one piece.  I'm waiting for the girl.  Her mother wants to talk to her.
Somehow I got along better with you on the phone.  It's all there isn't it?
They put their hands all over me.
So far they're keeping their part of it.
They tortured us.  And you're going to let them have all that money?
We've almost got your husband and your daughter out.  So don't get any ideas.
You're going to let them get away with this?
Because a lot of people would've gotten killed.  Probably all the wrong ones.
Why didn't you just shoot them?
Now I have -- it's a long story.
Include me in that.
She'll never be the same.  None of us will.
She'll be with you soon.  They're pulling up.  They'll realize I kept my part of the bargain.
Rachel was terrified when I left her.  I could see it in her eyes.
Shit.  I'm sorry.
It's locked.
Just start walking.  Come on. Walk to me.
Rachel -- Oh my God.
I'm sorry.  You've thought this out better than I ever could.  I'm ready now.
Once you're in the car with me she's sure to come to us.
All right.  Now that you explain it I see that you're right.
She's a child.  She might panic. She doesn't know me.  She might not come to me.  She might just run.
Why can't it be her?
They won't allow that.  It's one at a time.  And you have to be first.
Yes.  But I want Rachel to come with me.
Can you walk?
Yes.
Don't start thinking about it.  Is the tape off?
I can't do it.
She's next.  In two or three more minutes she'll be free.
I'm not leaving my daughter behind.  Not with them.
Lenore -- you promised you'd follow instructions.  We're almost there.  Simply get out when they slide the van open and walk to me.
Put the man back on.
Yes sir.
Now you're going to do just what I tell you to.  No discussion.  No hesitation.
Yes.
You're all three of you in that van?
He's in back.  Lying face down. They haven't hurt him anymore -- but he was crying.  I never heard Jack cry before --
Your husband?
She's awake but she hasn't spoken. I don't know what they did to her. I don't want to think about it.
That's coming off.  How about the girl?
They wrapped tape around my wrists and ankles.
Are you okay?
Thank you.  God bless you for helping us.
They're tied with duct tape so they can't speak -- but they seem to be --
I'm in possession of the bag he was carrying.  And I'm in a position to negotiate.  What about your husband and your child?
God, if he doesn't come back --
I had a little encounter at the bank and our Mr. Transplant ended up under the wheels of a Chevy.
What did you do?
Lucky for them they didn't.
They dragged me downstairs.  I thought they were going to kill me.
Hi Lenore.  It's me.  I got you back.  Courtesy of Star 69.  Are you hurt?
Yes?  Yes?
Try what you did before.  It worked before.  I won't talk anymore.
No.  I hear them.  They're coming upstairs.  They know!
Don't panic.  I might be wrong.  Hello?  I guess I was wrong.
Downstairs.  There must be an extension.  Oh my God --
Or somebody else there is listening in --
Yes -- I think so.  Another crossed line?
Did you hear that click?
No.
Did you jiggle the phone?

When they first started questioning Jack -- he answered them in that tone he usually reserves for me.  And they began beating him.  And I watched.  And I didn't feel anything ... What kind of a person am I?
You can't give up.
Because you're probably the last person I'll ever talk to.
Why tell me this?
Jack hasn't loved me for years. And now I'm afraid she's turning out to be like him.  So cold and distant.  I've let him make her like that.
I've got a lot of respect for you too.  For the way you feel about your family.
But I guess we haven't really met -- have we?
Yeah, sure that's me.  Ask anybody.
Theo, I want you to know, you're probably the most decent man I've ever met.
It won't be him.
If it's the tall man -- he had one of those hair transplants.  Tufts, you know.  It still hasn't grown fully in.  The other one is from the islands.  Braided hair -- very dark.
I might still get there first. The lights are with me.  How would I identify the guy who shows up at the bank?
The front door slammed.  Someone went out.  There's a different car starting.
What's going on?
Don't talk.  Don't talk!
How come everybody turns out to be a crook?
To hide it from the I.R.S.
You're doing what you can.  Why's all this money stashed?
Oh my God.  I heard her scream again.  What are they doing to her?  Why can't I do anything to stop them?
I'm pretty good at signatures myself.
It's not hard to do.  I do it all the time.
They've still got to be able to sign his name.
Jack was only at that branch once when he took the box years ago.
They'll recognize it's not your husband.
I'm not supposed to -- but I do. Millions in cash and bearer bonds.
Do you know what's in that box?
Don't say that.
Not a chance.
Jack will negotiate with them. He'll identify the right key and give them the information they need to gain access and they'll let Rachel go.
I'm cutting across to Bundy to Brentwood.  That bank is our best bet.  If anybody shows up I could follow them.
Even if you found us -- what then?
Which means you can't be more than five or ten minutes from here.
I heard someone pulling in behind the house.  I heard Rachel screaming and then she stopped all of a sudden.  I don't know what they did to her.
I'm not doing too well.  What's the matter?
Black Mercedes, 600S.
What do you mean?
Wait just a minute.  Our luck has changed.
The City National on San Vincente.
What bank?
The one in Brentwood.
You said they wanted to get into some particular safety deposit box?
When Jack sees they've got Rachel HE'LL tell them what they want to know.
I should've put them out of the car and come sooner!
It's not your fault, Theo.  You tried.
He's copying down my license -- for all the good it'll do him.
I'm trying to.
Don't say anything.  Don't alarm them.  Just go!
She's gone --
What's happening?
I've got to ask somebody.
No.
Does she wear glasses?
That's not her.
Does she have a red ribbon on that ponytail?
Great.  Stay with me.  There must be a hundred kids out here.
I can hear you again, clearly.
Lenore, I'm here.  I'm getting out.
I'm making my turn.  I see the school up ahead.
Make a right.  You can't miss it.
I've lost you.  You're gone.  I can't hear anything.
There are cables overhead.  Hang on.  It'll clear up.
You're breaking up.  I can't hear you.  Theo?

We don't reveal the names of our guests as a matter of policy. I know you'd appreciate that if your father came to live with us.
Just to be certain, I wonder if you could show us a list of your patients?
Don't be sorry, neither does Dad. Wanted to make sure though, didn't we, honey?
I'm sorry. We don't.
Do you accept anyone of the Jewish persuasion?
Of course.
There's just one question.
Perhaps if we could meet your father.
Naturally, I want the best for him, money is no object.
Nothing to do with Dad. It's me, actually.
Oh my goodness.

I don't want to nail you. I just want to know who put you up to it. I'll give you a few days to think it over.  Call me. I can help. Who knows? Maybe we can lay the whole thing off on a few big shots and you can stay head of the department for the next twenty years.
Yes...
Hard working, have a wife and kids...
Yes...
You're a married man, am I right?
Mr. Gittes, my field men are out and I can't give you an exact location...
That's like saying they're in Arizona.
I said, the northwest valley.
Yeah, a little runoff. Where are those orchards?

Wait. Please sit down, Mr. Gittes. We're... well, we're not anxious for this to get around, but we have been diverting a little water to irrigate avocado and walnut groves in the northwest valley. As you know, the farmers there have no legal right to our water, and since the drought we've had to cut them off. The city comes first, naturally.  But, well, we've been trying to help some of them out, keep them from going under. Naturally when you divert water you get a little runoff.
Well, Whitey Mehrholtz over at the Times will. Dumping thousands of gallons of water down the toilet in the middle of a drought.  That's news.
Mr. Gittes! That's an outrageous accusation.  I don't know what you're talking about.

Well, look at it this way, Mr. Yelburton.  Mulwray didn't want to build a dam and he had a reputation that was hard to get around, so. you decided to ruin it. Then he found out that you were dumping water every night. Then he was drowned.
Mr. Gittes, you're not making a bit of sense.
Neither do I, actually. But you hired me or you hired that chippie to hire me.
I don't understand.
I never was.
Only when you breathe... don't tell me you're still working for Mrs. Mulwray?
Only when I breathe.
You ought to be more careful. That must really smart.
I cut myself shaving.
Oh yes. Hollis was the best department head the city's ever had. My goodness, what happened to your nose?
Yeah, must be especially tough to take over under these circumstances.
Mr. Gittes, sorry to keep you waiting. These staff meetings, they just go on and on.
Hope so. He's working for us.
Relax, Mulvihill, glad to see you.  Do you know Claude Mulvihill here?
Help yourself.
Mind if I take one of your cards? In case I want to get in touch with you again.
Well, tell him I'll be back.
I'm sorry, I --
You don't happen to know where Mr. Mulwray's having lunch?
Maybe he takes it very seriously.
He never even kids about it.
And Mulwray isn't?
After all, you work with a man for a certain length of time, you come to know him, his habits, his values, and so forth. Well either he's the kind who chases after women or he isn't.
I wonder if you'd care to wait in my office?
J.J. Gittes. And it's not a departmental matter.
Can I help you?  Russ Yelburton, Deputy Chief in the Department.
That's what I thought. You see, I'm Mrs. Evelyn Mulwray. You know, Mr. Mulwray's wife.
Never.
Never?
Well, no.
Have we ever met?
Well... I think I... I would've remembered.
Do you know me?
Yes?
Mr. Gittes?
Comes in different parts of the river. Every night a different part.
When it comes? What'd you tell him?
When it comes.
What about the water?
The water.
Didn't you talk to a man here... few days ago... wore glasses... he...
Si.
Speak English?... Habla Ingles?
Yeah, well he ain't gonna drown in a damp riverbed either, I don't care how soused he was. That's like drowning in a teaspoon.
It's not completely dry.
It's bone dry, Morty.
Yeah, under Hollenbeck Bridge, what's wrong with that?
The L.A. River?
Yeah, got dead drunk, passed out in the bottom of the riverbed.
Come again?
Drowned, too.
Yeah.
So how are you, Morty?
That's a long fall.
Yeah. Banged up pretty bad.
Yeah? Ain't that something? Middle of a drought, the water commissioner drowns. Only in L.A.
Nothin', Morty, it's my lunch hour, I thought I'd drop by and see who died lately.
Jake, what're you doin' here?
Well, tell you what, pal. If Ida wants to see me she can call me at my office.
Sure you do.
Yeah?... I do?
Who?
Ida Sessions wants to see you.
Yeah.
Gittes?... Gittes?
Money doesn't matter to me, Mr. Gittes.
This type of investigation can be hard on your pocketbook, Mrs. Mulwray. It takes time.
Water and Power?
Hollis. Hollis Mulwray.
All right, what's your husband's first name?
But I have to know.
I'm sure he loves you, too. You know the expression, let sleeping dogs lie? You're better off not knowing.
But...
Then go home and forget about it.
...Yes of course.
Mrs. Mulwray, do you love your husband?
Now, what makes you certain he is involved with someone?
Of course not.
I'm afraid not, Mrs. Mulwray. These men are my operatives and at some point they're going to assist me. I can't do everything myself.
Can't we talk about this alone, Mr. Gittes?
I am sorry.
I'm afraid so.
No, really?
Now, Mrs. Mulwray, what seems to be the problem?
Mr. Gittes...
How do you do, Mrs. Mulwray?
Yeah, I'll do that.
Lot of turnover these days. Better tell them to get in touch with me if they want to hang onto their land.
Yeah.
Never heard of 'em... new owners?
That's swell. But how about here?  Ever worked for Robert Knox, Emma Dill, Clarence Speer, Marian Parsons, or Jasper Lamar Crabb?
City of La Habra Heights filled an 800,000 gallon reservoir with sixteen inches of rain in two days.
Yeah.  Do you have any references?
No problem with me on the Job.
Yes. Yes, they were partners.
They were partners.
Along with Mr. Mulwray.
Mulwray? I thought you said Cross owned the department.
Mr. Mulwray felt the public should own the display. The water. If you'll just read the display.
How did they get it away from him?
Yes.
He owned the entire water supply for the city?
Yes.
He owned the water department?
He owned it.
He did or he didn't?
Yes. No.
Julian Cross worked for the water department?
I take a long lunch. All day sometimes.
He's liable to be tied up indefinitely.
Well I'm on my lunch hour. I'll wait.
Mr. Yelburton will be busy for some time.
Fifteen minutes ago. Why don't I go in and wait?
He was expecting you?
Gee whiz.  And I'm late.
Since lunch.
It's personal. Has he been out long?
May I ask what this is regarding?
Gittes.
He's not in, Mr.?
Mr. Mulwray, please.
Gimme your keys. Watch this old fart, will you?  Take Duffy's car. Curly's boat's in Pedro, near the Starkist cannery. It's the Evening Star. He'll be waiting. I'll take care of this.
Jake, it's Chinatown. They're all over the place. You oughta know better.
Duffy, go over and sit on Mulvihill.  Jesus Christ, I didn't tell you to bring the police department with you.
Sue people like that they're liable to be having dinner with the Judge who's trying the suit.
Yeah. What's wrong with you guys? Think ahead. We find 'em, sue 'em. We'll make a killing.  We'll have dinner at Chasen's twice a week, we'll be pissing on ice the rest of our lives.
Yeah?
I don't want Mulvihill.  I want the big boys that are making the payoffs.
Think you can nail Mulvihill? They'll claim you were trespassing.
They're all a bunch of phonies.
So he says you sent them?
When I find out who that phony bitch was.
No, no. She said not to call, her husband might answer.
All she needed for that was the phone book!
Look, Jake. She gave us Mulwray's real phone number and address.
Let me explain something to you, Walsh. This business requires a certain finesse.
Look, you tell me to take pictures, I take pictures.
Jesus Christ, Walsh. That's what you spent your day doing?
Yeah.
Apple core?
I don't know. The traffic was pretty loud. I only heard one thing  apple core.
What about?
They got into a terrific argument outside the Pig 'n Whistle.
This?
No, you have a press agent do it.
Neither do I.
We don't publish a record in the paper, I can tell you that.
Tell me, how many people a week do you foreclose on?
Mortgage Department, First National Bank.
Oh? What do you do to make ends meet?
Nothing. You got a hell of a way to make a living.
What's that, pal?
Cross was looking for her all over the country. Offered rewards, everything. Felt real sorry for him, with all his money.
You don't say?
She ran off to Mexico. Rumor was she was knocked up and didn't even know who the father was. Went there to get rid of it.
We missed the best of it, didn't we, pal?
Oh, you know. She was sixteen or seventeen.
Why'd she run away?
That's for sure.
Well, you never know, do you?
Course, she settled down nicely.
Oh yeah, it was a big thing at the time. Julian Cross' daughter. God almighty. She was a wild little thing.
She ran away?
No, he's only got one, I remember her age, I read it in the newspapers when she ran away.
You must be thinking of a different daughter.
She must be about thirty-three, thirty- four.
She ain't exactly long in the tooth now.
That right?... She used to be some looker.
I'm working for his daughter.
Is the Pope Catholic? Who are you, mister?... I ask because he doesn't see a whole lot of people.
I'm going to see a man called Julian Cross. Ever heard of him?
Lots of fellas do. Tell the little woman they're going on a fishing trip, then shack up with some little twist on the island... she pretty?
But that's what you told your wife.
Not exactly.
Whatever you do, love it like you loved that projection booth of the Paradiso when you were little...
Thanks for all you've done for me.

No, Toto, nobody said it. I say it! Life's not like you saw it in the movies. Life...is harder.  Get out! Go back to Rome. You 're young, the world is yours! And I'm old...I don't want to hear you talk any more, I want to hear talk about you.
Who said that? Gary Cooper, James Stewart, Henry Fonda? Huh?

Do like the soldier, Toto! Go away! This land is cursed.  When you're here every day you feel like you're at the center of the universe, it seems like nothing ever changes. Then you go away, one year, two...And when you come back, everything's different. The thread has broken. You don't find those you were looking for, your things no longer exist. Isn't that the case?...You've got to go away a long time, for many, many years, before coming back and finding your people again, the land where you were born...But not now, it's impossible. Now you're blinder than I am.

Now I understand why the soldier went away just before the end. That's right, just one more night and the princess would have been his. But she, also, could not have kept her promise. And...that would have been terrible, he would have died from it. So instead, for ninety-nine nights at least he had lived with the illusion that she was there waiting for him...

Listen to this one...The commander says to the sergeant: 'You remember that windmill that used to be there?' 'Yes, sir, I remember the mill's gone but the wind's still there!'  You remember the story of the soldier and the princess?
It was probably meant to be like this. Each of us has a star to follow. So now what are you thinking of doing?
No. And nobody knows where she is.
Did you ever see her again?
Toto, sooner or later there comes a time when talking or keeping quiet is the same thing. So it's better to shut up.  It's hot in here. Toto, take me to the beach.
They tell me you never go out, never talk to anybody. Why?
You 're thinner...You can tell you've not been treated well. .
No, nobody came.
I'm here! Take it easy! Take it easy!  Sit down, sit down...  Did she come?
But where'd you go, Toto?!!
You were expecting her? Huh?  ...It's a nasty business waiting by yourself. In company it's better. No?...Then I'll leave.
No, Alfredo, I was coming to help you...
You weren't expecting me?
Could be...But I don't like this business. It smells fishy to me.
Just so, Alfredo. There isn't any. And if you buy a television set, you can watch it at home, without any fuss...
Toto, are you pulling my leg or something? How is it possible to see this television without film?
No! You mean right at the end?  ALFREDO That's right, Toto, right at the end? And don't ask me what it means. If you figure it out, let me know...

I want to make you happy, Toto! I'm going to tell you a story.  Once upon a time a king gave a feast and there were all the most beautiful princesses of the realm. Basta, one of the guards, saw the king's daughter: she was the loveliest of all! And he immediately fell in love with her. But what could a poor soldier do compared with a king's daughter?!...One day he managed to meet her and told her he couldn't live without her. The princess was so struck by the depth of his feeling that she said to the soldier  'If you will wait a hundred days and a hundred nights beneath my balcony, then in the end I'll be yours.' Christ, the soldier ran off there and waited! One day, two days, ten, twenty...Every night she looked out of her window, but he never budged. Come rain, wind, snow, never budged! The birds shat on him and the bees ate him alive! After ninety nights he was gaunt and pale and tears streamed from his eyes but he couldn't hold them back. He didn't even have the strength to sleep any more. The princess kept watch...And on the ninety-ninth night, the soldier got up, picked up his chair and left!
You see, it s like I say. You always have an answer for everything.

Heeey! Totooooo! Don't get pissed off with me now! Come here! I don't know where the fuck I have to go.  And the next time be careful how you talk. Not to take credit away from the Lord, but if I had created the world, in all modesty, certain things would have come out better. But unfortunately such was not the case.
Stop it! I've had enough of your sermons! You act as if you created the world!
Don't think about it, Toto. Don't even try. With feelings, there's nothing to understand.
But why? There must be some way to make her understand!
I told you, the blue-eyed ones are the most difficult.
They're not my words. John Wayne said it in Shepherd of the Hills.
What you say is wonderful! But sad...

Eh! Love...what a mystery!  I understand you, Toto...The ones with blue eyes are the most beautiful. Whatever you do, you can't make friends with them.  Eh, there's nothing to be done about it! The heavier a man is, the deeper his footprints. And if he's in love, he suffers, because he knows he's up a one-way street. Because love is a meaningless thing when a man gets it into his head to do what he wants...
What's she like? What's she like?...
Yes, it's a girl I saw at the station.
Is there a woman?...Tell me the truth...  There is a woman.
Nothing, there's nothing. It's all out of focus.
Now what can you see?
It's people in the slaughter-house killing a calf. There's blood all over the floor, like a lake. And through this lake another calf passes by on its way to die.
What is it, what is it? What's the picture?
Yes.

I've shown it so many times I know it by heart. The first time I showed it, in 1940, was the Sunday my first wife died. They kept it hidden from me all day so they wouldn't have to close down the movie house. I only found out that night, after the last show. Those are things you never forget...  So, Toto, how are these home movies going?
That's right, Modern Times.
Chaplin's Modern Times! Right, Toto?
Progress! It always arrives too late!
What'd I tell you? It doesn't catch fire!
For example, at this moment the film's out of focus. Go see.
Yes. I want proof.

Toto, this isn't for you. For the moment, the Cinema Paradiso needs you, and you need the Cinema Paradiso. But it won't last...Some day you'll have other things to do, more important things...  That's right, more important. I know it. Now that I've lost my sight I see more. I see everything I didn't see before...  And it's all thanks to you, who saved my life. And I'll never forget it...  And don't put on that look. I haven't gone off my head yet. You want proof?
Why? What do you mean?
Don't do that...Sooner or later you'll be left empty-handed.
OK. OK. But now that I've got a job, I'11 probably stop going...
How's school?
Come in, Alfredo.
Any room for me in this Cinema Paradiso?
Too bad!
It's got to be sent to another town. And if we don't the owner of that movie house gets pissed off.
Peppinoooo! Come back sooon!!  Good thing Germany's closer than Russia.
Who knows?...It's like an adventure.  Hope springs eternal...
Will they really find work in Germany?
It tastes wonderful!
You understand which side the gelatin's on?
Alfredo, go fuck yourself!!!

With time...you get used to it. Besides, when you hear from up here that there's a full house and that people are laughing, having fun... Then you're happy too.  So I've been wasting my breath? You pretend to agree with me, but as soon as my back is turned, you do what you want!  Get out of here! I don't want to lay eyes on you again! This is the last straw! Your mother's right, you're crazy!!  But how'd he do it? The little bastard! By watching, he's learned! It's incredible!  I'm letting the box office know you're not to set foot even into the theatre! There are no more tickets for you! And I'm also talking to Father Adelfio! You won't be an altar boy any more either!!! You little runt!
But don't you like anything about what you do?

Good for you, Toto. Good for you... I'm only saying this for your own good...  Cooped up in here you die of heat in the summer and of cold in the winter. You breathe in smoke, gas fumes, and earn practically nothing.
No...

Because I'm an idiot. How many other guys in town know how to be a projectionist? None! Only a jerk like me could do it. Besides I wasn't lucky. When I was a kid there was the war!
